Chelsea have around £150million to spend, with Zaha likely to push for a move away from Palace having failed to secure a move to Arsenal in the summer. The Blues have been scouting targets for months in anticipation of a positive outcome over their CAS appeal.

Among a host of possible options, they are keen on re-signing Nathan Ake from Bournemouth and have identified Ben Chilwell as a long-term replacement for Marcos Alonso at left-back.

Leicester are determined to hold on to Chilwell until at least the end of the season and value the England international in excess of £60m. He signed a contract extension in October last year and is tied to the club until 2024.Borussia Dortmund winger Jadon Sancho is another longer-term target — and would cost at least £100m — while Lyon striker Moussa Dembele has also been extensively scouted.

Exclusive: Chelsea manager Frank Lampard will assess Antonio Rudiger's form and fitness before deciding on Nathan Ake move |
@Matt_Law_DT
https://t.co/Q4GjtqWuJc?amp=1

Having sold him to Bournemouth for £20m in 2017, Chelsea believe they can re-sign Ake for around £40m which is well under his market value. The Dutchman was valued at £70m during the summer, when Manchester United and City were looking for a defender.

Ake ticks a series of boxes for Lampard and Chelsea. He is left-footed and, as well as playing in the centre of defence, the 24-year-old can fill in at left-back and in midfield. He also qualifies as home-grown and would be eligible to play for the Blues in Europe.

A number of clubs in England and France are interested in Giroud, who is about to enter the final six months of his Chelsea contract, and he is ready to ask to go now the Blues can sign a replacement.

Lyon’s Moussa Dembele and Red Bull Leipzig’s Timo Werner are two strikers Chelsea have shown an interest in, but it is unclear whether or not they would be available in January. CSKA Moscow forward Fedor Chalov has been linked with a move to Stamford Bridge, while Wilfried Zaha will again look to leave Crystal Palace.

Chelsea are also interested in signing a wide man and a left back, but top targets such as Jadon Sancho and Ben Chilwell are unlikely to be available in January. Out-of-favour Spaniards Pedro Rodriguez and Marcos Alonso could join Giroud in pushing for moves away.
